comment.author: 25695066@N00
comment._content:
This is Pan American Boeing 707-321, N791PA (c/n 18715/364), Jet Clipper Fidelity.  Clipper Fidelity would continue in operation with Pan Am until the late 1970s, when it was sold to Maverick (under the same registration), and then  Turkish Airlines Cargo (THY Cargo) for conversion and use as a freighter (TC-JCC). After THY, it would pass to  Bosphorus Air Transport (BHT - Bogazici Hava Tasimaciligi), before going to Golden Star Air Cargo in January 1992 (ST-ALX).

Sadly, while flying for Golden Star Air Cargo, this aircraft crashed on Mt. Hymettus (killing all seven on board) while on approach to Athens, Greece (ATH) in March 1992.

comment.author: 19658725@N00
comment._content: How long did JFK have those rear-door jetways?

comment._content: It's not a jumbo. It's a 707-321C
